title: How to Survive Through Ravenholm in Half Life 2

steps.headline: Listen.
steps.description: Since the enemies are headcrabs and mindless zombies, they make noise. If you listen carefully, you won't be surprise-attacked.

steps.headline: Figure out the type of the zombie(s).
steps.description: There are three zombie and headcrab types. Normal zombies, the most common, are slow moving, and say things muffled by the headcrab. Skeletal zombies are thin and very fast and make high pitched howling when at a distance, and ferocious gasping noises when nearby. Poison zombies are slow, hard to kill and throw venomous headcrabs at you. They make aggressive grunts.

steps.headline: To conserve ammunition, use the gravity gun as much as possible.
steps.description: throw barrels, saw blades and exploding barrels.

steps.headline: Get saw blades.
steps.description: Saw blades, when used with the gravity gun, are extremely effective for killing zombies, try to carry one or two saw blades as far as you can through the chapter before ditching one.

steps.headline: Aim for the head.
steps.description: If you don't, the headcrab will survive and attack you

steps.headline: The gravity gun's primary fire attack works against headcrabs.
steps.description: Common headcrabs and thin headcrabs (both flesh colored) require four hits from the gravity gun's primary fire to be killed, venomous headcrabs (black with red and white rings on the legs) need three to kill.

steps.headline: Stay calm, take breaks in necessary.
When first in the mines, stay on the high wooden struts and use the magnum to take out the venomous headcrabs.
steps.description: The venomous headcrabs are larger, black, and move slowly compared to the thin headcrabs, which have similar proportions, but move much more quickly.

steps.headline: Duck.
steps.description: The zombies will throw things at you, so be careful. Physics objects hurt more than bullets.

steps.headline: Partway through the chapter, you are given a shotgun that holds six shells.
steps.description: Reload whenever you have a break, and aim for the head.

text: Listen. Since the enemies are headcrabs and mindless zombies, they make noise. If you listen carefully, you won't be surprise-attacked. Figure out the type of the zombie(s). There are three zombie and headcrab types. Normal zombies, the most common, are slow moving, and say things muffled by the headcrab. Skeletal zombies are thin and very fast and make high pitched howling when at a distance, and ferocious gasping noises when nearby. Poison zombies are slow, hard to kill and throw venomous headcrabs at you. They make aggressive grunts. To conserve ammunition, use the gravity gun as much as possible. throw barrels, saw blades and exploding barrels. Get saw blades. Saw blades, when used with the gravity gun, are extremely effective for killing zombies, try to carry one or two saw blades as far as you can through the chapter before ditching one. Aim for the head. If you don't, the headcrab will survive and attack you The gravity gun's primary fire attack works against headcrabs. Common headcrabs and thin headcrabs (both flesh colored) require four hits from the gravity gun's primary fire to be killed, venomous headcrabs (black with red and white rings on the legs) need three to kill. Stay calm, take breaks in necessary.  When first in the mines, stay on the high wooden struts and use the magnum to take out the venomous headcrabs. The venomous headcrabs are larger, black, and move slowly compared to the thin headcrabs, which have similar proportions, but move much more quickly. Duck. The zombies will throw things at you, so be careful. Physics objects hurt more than bullets. Partway through the chapter, you are given a shotgun that holds six shells. Reload whenever you have a break, and aim for the head.
